Description: Join professional artist Melody Jones on a evening to rediscover your passion for artmaking. Enhance your artistic skills and knowledge, and gain new ideas for the classroom. Meet and connect with other artmakers and teachers, and enjoy a glass of wine and light refreshments while brushing up on your drawing skills during these friendly and structured life drawing workshop. Lake Arts Member: $31.50 + booking fee Check out more dates in our Twilight Time Out for teachers series here: Twilight Time Out for Teachers: Portraiture: Wednesday, 20 March 2024 Twilight Time Out for Teachers: Life Drawing with Sue: Wednesday, 27 March 2024 About MAC The Museum of Art and Culture (MAC, yapang) is located at the end of First Street, Booragul, on the edge of Lake Macquarie. MAC has ramp access for wheelchairs and prams, baby changing facilities and accessible toilets. MAC can be reached easily from the lake foreshore cycleway, the water, or by public transport. There is plenty of parking for cars, and buses with accessible spaces available, onsite and adjacent to the Hunter Rowing Club. Mel is a local, contemporary artist who specializes in large scale figurative drawing. Life drawing is at the core of her practice ‚Äú My current body of work employs potent, dynamic figures frozen or ‚ÄòSuspended‚Äô in motion and time, which challenge and reposition the passive plasticity of women historically represented in Western art whilst assimilating issues in the world around me‚Äù. She employs a range of research methods including recording acrobatic performance through photography, often editing with Photoshop. The mediums pastel, watercolor and charcoal are often utilized to produce multi layered works on paper attempting to capture fluidity, form, drama and time. Awards:  2022- Blackstone Works on Paper Prize (Finalist) 2022- National Capital Art Prize, (Finalist) 2021 -Lake Mac Artist and Creator (Winner) 2021- Blackstone Works on Paper Prize (Finalist) 2021 - National Capital Art Prize, (Finalist) 2019 - Doug Moran, semi finalist 2019 - Sue McCrea Memorial Drawing Prize, (Finalist) 2019 - Marie Ellis Drawing Prize, (Finalist) 2018 - Adelaide Perry Drawing Prize, (Finalist) 2016 - Kennedy Prize, (Finalist)
Title: Twilight Time Out for Teachers: Life Drawing
Subtitle: Calling all teachers! Join us for a relaxing evening of life drawing with artist Melody Jones

Description: Join Dan from Cymatic Harmony for a 90 minute transformative sound healing experience as he embarks on a tour up the east coast of Australia, starting from the Mornington Peninsula in Victoria where he is based. The session will begin with a 15-20 minute grounding Breathwork transitioning into the ethereal sounds of handpans, the crystal harp, crystal & Tibetan singing bowls, harmonium, shamanic instruments, Native American flutes, chimes, rain stick, ocean drum & gongs washing over you. Dan creates a peaceful and meditative atmosphere to help you relax, feel what needs to be felt & let go of anything you may be holding on to. Through the power of sound & breath, you'll be guided on a journey of self-discovery and inner healing, as Dan takes you through a series of healing frequencies & vibrations that are designed to balance your mind, body, and spirit. Whether you're new to sound healing or a seasoned practitioner, this event promises to be an unforgettable & unique experience that will leave you feeling refreshed and renewed. To see & learn more about your facilitator head over to the Cymatic Harmony Instagram Account. PLEASE NOTE: Mats and some props will be provided. feel free to bring along anything that will make you extra comfy. Please arrive no later than 7.20pm to allow yourself to ground and not rushed. In Sonic & Cymatic Resonance

What To Expect To help you get the most out of your meeting, here are some things to know before you go: Be Prepared: to talk about your business. You don't need a speech, just to be able to tell others what you do. You will have 20 seconds during the meeting to introduce yourself. You can check out our members here: https://bit.ly/3i411qH Meetings: Use this time to experience the atmosphere of the group and how the meeting runs. Meetings are high energy and run according to a structured agenda. You will find out a little bit about all the members of the group during this time. We also like to have some fun, so don't expect it to all be serious. The meetings last around 90 minutes with time for additional networking after each meeting. We also have a feature presentation each week from one of the members. Our upcoming speakers are listed here: https://bit.ly/3fBq5lG You're Special: You will be given information about how to join our group when you visit. But there is no pressure. We simply love having visitors. Only one person from each professional specialty is allowed to join a our group. if you decide to apply for membership and you are successful, you will be the sole representative of your field and can develop relationships with others in the chapter as their go-to person for your services. We look forward to seeing you at our meeting!

Description: Join our museum volunteers to learn more about the inaugural exhibition 'Westy: we built this history'.  Sugar Valley Library Museum is the first of its kind in Lake Macquarie, showcasing the rich history of West Wallsend.  Developed in conjunction with the West Wallsend District Heritage Group, the exhibition presents the story of the region through enticing and immersive experiences, and objects portraying the life and times of this unique township. TÔªøhe Museum contains interactive elements such as the Hunter's first virtual reality experience of an underground coal mine including oral histories from those that worked the site, historic objects from the West Wallsend and District Heritage Group‚Äôs collection and an engaging entertaining hands-on history experience. Our younger visitors will also have the opportunity to get up close with history through the 'Play Museum' and the Discovery cabinets.

Description: We all know that the PhD process is a journey with highs and lows, and sometimes stress and anxiety can take over. So it‚Äôs important to have strategies in place to regulate our nervous systems and quieten our minds. Description: Do you want to improve your public speaking abilities and become more influential in both business and life? Using our proven systems, you'll learn how to overcome your fear of speaking, create powerful and persuasive speeches, and captivate any audience with your charisma and confidence. Our course is delivered in a virtual live format, and upon successfully completing the program, participants will receive a Course Completion Certificate. This 12-week program is designed for transformation if that's your goal your search ends here. WÔªøHAT MAKE US DIFFERENT Exercises are designed to overcome any fear, anxiety or panic episodes and transform you into an influential Speaker. TÔªøhe 12-week program is designed to target the 12 aspects of public speaking mentioned below. VOCAL IMAGE Session 1. Rate of Speech Session 2. Volume Session 3. Pitch & Melody Session 4. Tonality Session 5. Pause VISUAL IMAGE Session-6. Introduction to Body Language Session 7.Posture -Body Language BEHAVIOUR Session 8 - Vocal Archetype- motivator Session 9 - Vocal Archetype - educator Session 10 - Vocal Archetype- Instructor Session 11 - Vocal Archetype- Friend ART Session 12 - Storytelling This one free trial class is YOUR FREE PASS to see if this program is the right fit for you. The Coach will be happy to answer any questions following the session.
Title: Afraid of Public Speaking? FREE Virtual Class to Banish Anxiety and Fears.
Subtitle: Want to improve your public speaking skills, and become more influential in business & life, this is a MUST-attend TRAINING.

Refund_Policy: NA
Description: EquiEnergy Youth is a not-for-profit and registered charity that is dedicated to improving mental health outcomes for children and young people across Australia. Our programs are designed to build capacity in communities to support the mental health of children and young people and reduce instances of psychological distress, self-harm and the risk of suicide. We have recently provided our coaching programs for the schools in your community and part of that involves giving local families and carers a complimentary session to help you support the mental health of the children and young people in your life. You will learn an approach that is evidence-based, innovative and practical. We train, coach and guide adults in the most effective responses to children and young people experiencing episodes of acute distress. As a result of a PhD research project and thousands of hours of clinical experience, Dr Stephen Spencer has developed a simple, easy to follow method to guide adults on how and when to effectively respond to young people in distress and achieve a positive outcome. The program will be held from 5.30pm to 7pm on Wednesday 13th of March 2024 at Kurri Kurri Bowling Club. Attendance is complimentary and bookings are essential.
Title: Coach 2 Cope: Families and Carers  by Dr Stephen Spencer (PhD)
Subtitle: Equi Energy Youth presents Coach 2 Cope: Families and Carers program. Supporting the mental health and wellbeing of children & young people.

Description: Don't miss your chance to join Jo from Beat It Music & Movement for this amazing group drumming experience! If you have booked tickets for one of our events & you find you are unable to attend, please let us know by doing one of the following things: a. email us: library@cessnock.nsw.gov.au b. call us on 4993 4399 for Cessnock Library or 4937 1638 for Kurri Kurri Library c. log into your Eventbrite account and cancel your booking Booking means that we have saved a chair for you. Letting us know that you are unable to attend an event enables others to participate. Remember, bookings are essential. See you at the library!
